body:
v0.24.0 adds -vv flag for streaming test output in real-time.

Implementation:
- Uses mpsc channel to receive lines from stdout/stderr as they arrive
- Two threads read stdout and stderr separately, sending lines to the channel
- Main thread receives lines and calls the callback immediately
- StreamingContext struct holds progress_tx and test metadata for sending TestOutput events

Key files:
- runner.rs: run_command_streaming(), StreamingContext
- output.rs: print_progress() handles TestOutput event
- cli.rs: verbose is now u8 (count) instead of bool

Note: With -vv, stdout/stderr lines may interleave in non-deterministic order since both are read concurrently.
title: cctr -vv streaming output implementation
